TopicTitle: Devnote Tuesdays: The "Can't Spell Kerbal without K" Edition

Articles.Content:
<p><strong>Marco (Samssonart): </strong><span>IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m currently working on crew transfer, meaning there will be no more need to EVA kerbals to transfer them among docked crafts.</span></p>

Meh, I'm not crazy about this. It sorta makes sense that you can transfer fuel around your ship, using the rationalization that there are internal pipes and valves internal to the various parts.

But if I have two hitchhikers separated by three long fuel tanks, it doesn't make sense that I can move Kerbals through the fuel tanks. I hope this is limited to crew compartments that are adjacent to each other...then that makes some sense. But you should still be required to EVA if you are moving a Kerbal across an entire ship of struts and fuel tanks!

Meh, I'm not crazy about this. It sorta makes sense that you can transfer fuel around your ship, using the rationalization that there are internal pipes and valves internal to the various parts.

But if I have two hitchhikers separated by three long fuel tanks, it doesn't make sense that I can move Kerbals through the fuel tanks. I hope this is limited to crew compartments that are adjacent to each other...then that makes some sense. But you should still be required to EVA if you are moving a Kerbal across an entire ship of struts and fuel tanks!

This calls for an another Apollo mission :-)

I also hope they will make it in a logical way & not mess it up...
I think certain parts may have a crew transfer=1 stat or something. like structural fuselage

No offense to GregroxMun(our official hypetrain conductor), but at this point in the process a train is not needed. any actual update is a good long while away, so I think a hypetram, or hypetrolley would be much better. Maybe a really small hype trolley based off of this super incredible high-speed design

But... The Hype train never stops...

Yay crew manifest!

Yay enhanced navball!

Yay spaceplane plus!

Yay 0.25!

Yayyyyyyyyyyy!

Preeeetty much sums up my feelings at the moment.

I still want the banana

Edited August 20, 2014 by Avera9eJoe

Meh, I'm not crazy about this. It sorta makes sense that you can transfer fuel around your ship, using the rationalization that there are internal pipes and valves internal to the various parts.

But if I have two hitchhikers separated by three long fuel tanks, it doesn't make sense that I can move Kerbals through the fuel tanks. I hope this is limited to crew compartments that are adjacent to each other...then that makes some sense. But you should still be required to EVA if you are moving a Kerbal across an entire ship of struts and fuel tanks!

Hopefully the implementation will include something like Connected Living Spaces, which differentiates between parts that can pass crew through them and those that cannot.

No. This is something new.

The HydroTrain.

Train on the water...

Hopefully the implementation will include something like Connected Living Spaces, which differentiates between parts that can pass crew through them and those that cannot.

I would rather let the player decide if he wants to or not.

Train on the water...

Or knowing the Kerbal way of doing things... smoke on the water after attempting a dive to -500m from orbit

Boris

wonder if my huge rover will sink now after its booster falls apart at 10Km up....

First of all, I'd like to throw a "thank you, SQAUD" over the ocean. *throws*

This is a dev note worth the title, what I missed for a long time.

It gave a feeling about what is going on and seeds a feeling of curiosity, what the next update will be about in detail.

So - thank you for giving a note that does not feel like "dev note content is for the weak".

Kudos, really nice Devnote....love the technical stuff

Even if you can't talk about the results of what you are doing, just talk about the challenges you had during the week...interesting enough.

EDIT:

and to add to the speculation: well, they said largest effort in 3D asset addition....so...Spaceport is fine, Parts are beeing done....well, i guess you are revamping all the PLANETS to Moon quality then? YEY

Edited August 20, 2014 by TNM
Say - where's Jesus gotten to? It's been a while since he put something in the devnotes.

We're really glad you feel this was a vastly improved devnote. It's not going to be this chocked full of big info every week, so savor it What I'm hoping though, is to at least include some more technical info during those times when news isn't coming out of every corner. Hopefully, that will keep the tide rolling in your eyes.

Say - where's Jesus gotten to? It's been a while since he put something in the devnotes.

Generally he's been offline when they've been sent. He's still hanging around, though.
So long as we get enough info to let us know what's happening I'm sure I, and hopefully the community as a whole, will be okay with it.

Jim (Romfarer): The framework (EzGUI) we use for this canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t handle that so i had to come up with a nifty trick to make that work. ...

While a good idea, it sounds a bit fragile to me.

While a good idea, it sounds a bit fragile to me.

I wonder if the Unity GUI overhaul in 4.6 will ease these problems?

So long as we get enough info to let us know what's happening I'm sure I, and hopefully the community as a whole, will be okay with it.

It's not even really that, it's making an effort on devnotes. "SQUAD Roll-Call" is uninteresting and does nothing to keep people excited about the game. It also looks really bad, like no one is interested, or has any enthusiasm left, or lacks an actual plan for the future of the game. I mean, sure, Rows is over here trying to keep everyone upbeat and generally being an awesome community manager, but it's telling (or rather, disturbing) when no one else shares that enthusiasm.

E: Anyway, this was a great example of how devnotes should look. Other companies manage this all the time and, as is hopefully quite obvious by this thread, communities greatly appreciate it.

Edited August 20, 2014 by regex

Oooh, idea: it seems as if crew movement is a possibility, and as there is this new massive modeling project... could crew IVA (movement) be coming in .25 or so?

That would be pretty nice.

And if cargo bays are coming, my spaceplane program is set.

Why would they be? Hugo revamped the Mk1 and Mk3 parts, and porkjet's mod focuses on the Mk 2 series. Hugo supplied the new Mk1 and Mk3, and porkjet supplied the new Mk2. The whole family is getting revamped/replaced to my understanding.

Where did you read this? Does that mean we are also getting a MkIII payload bay? Oh please, let that be so... That's like, the part I have awaited for longer for squad to make (It NEEDED to be in the game!). With the possible exception of stock drills and refineries. Could that be that "resource intensive" feature? Though if it continues with the theme of the parts to be added, we may be getting finally the reworked stock aerodynamic model. That would also satiate me, to be honest, I can live with kethane.

Rune. A kerbal can hope...
If that means some new challenges and opportunities both in-atmosphere and at-sea, I'm all for a new aerodynamic model!

Also, we released the updated version of <em>KerbalEdu</em> with 0.24.2 features. And IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m almost done with changes to the <em>KSP</em> Store website.

In other news we updated the edu version of the game, so all you <em>KerbalEDU</em> users will now have version 0.24.2.

Hmm... I know the site says only educational organizations can get their hands on the KerbalEDU mod but I would really be willing to pay more for access to it. Are there any plans on making this more accessible in the future?

Keep in mind there is an entire homeschooling market out there you are cutting out by selling exclusively to institutions.

Edit: My interest is some what both professional and personal on this. As an undergrad in astrophysics I taught 9th grade science at my church's private school. So I am happy that access is being provided to schools. However, I know, personally, many families that homeschool their children and who could benefit from this and though my own 4 children have not as of yet reached school age I very possibly may end up homeschooling them as well and very much look forward to the opportunity to use this as an educational tool for them also. In any case my point is I hope KerbalEDU does not get institutionalized leaving the rest of us out in the cold.

Edited August 21, 2014 by mcirish3

Where did you read this? Does that mean we are also getting a MkIII payload bay? Oh please, let that be so... That's like, the part I have awaited for longer for squad to make (It NEEDED to be in the game!).

I have no clue on the Mk3 cargo bays, but from the "here's something hugo made" we know those are the new Mk3, and Hugo talked about the Mk1 Series in devnotes and somebody found a picture of a revamped Mk1 Cockpit. (sorry I don't know where it is for sure but it looked nice, fit in well with the new Mk3)

Oooh, idea: it seems as if crew movement is a possibility, and as there is this new massive modeling project... could crew IVA (movement) be coming in .25 or so?

That would be pretty nice.

That is the first plausible suggestion I have heard this entire thread.

And it would be awesome.

That is the first plausible suggestion I have heard this entire thread.

And it would be awesome.

I hope that doesn't mean mean all current Mod IVAs are scrapped in .25

Edited August 21, 2014 by nli2work

Oooh, idea: it seems as if crew movement is a possibility, and as there is this new massive modeling project... could crew IVA (movement) be coming in .25 or so?

That would be pretty nice.

That was also my first thought, i already wrote that thing in some 'what would you want the most'-thread. Imagine full internal IVA's and missions you could do that way, especially with stuff like RasterProp. But is it really likely? Full IVA sounds more like a coding challenge to me, with moving/bending/breaking ships.

It would be amazing, though. And 'dozens of high quality models' certainly could point into that direction.

Otherwise i'd put my money on planet-reworks. Maybe custom-made areas using the new algorithms, including bioms, maybe more objects for the scenery.

I hope that doesn't mean mean all current Mod IVAs are scrapped in .25

They might need some rework, but i'm not sure why they would need to be scrapped.

Edited August 21, 2014 by Temeter

Rune. A kerbal can hope...

Rune, I know pretty much for a fact that there are more Mk3 parts. Rowsdower answered a different question of mine by saying Hugos cockpit and I think Mk3 tank was cut from a larger picture of parts. Plus, if there are Mk2 parts and cargo bays coming out, wouldn't it make sense to have Mk3 versions? I've seen what you can do with Mk3 sized parts and I'd love an Mk3 bay too. I feel safe assuming there is an Mk3 bay but like usual, don't quote me on that .

I wonder if the Unity GUI overhaul in 4.6 will ease these problems?

Well the Beta of Unity 4.6 with the GUI overhaul was announced for download at Unite

Is this a step up, down, sideways from the ezGUI?
